title: Acid (vial)
contents: text | As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

title: Adamantine Ammunition
contents: text | Ammunition made of or coated with adamantine is unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever a piece of adamantine ammunition hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.
text | The adamantine version of ten pieces of ammunition costs 500 gp more than the normal version, whether the ammunition is made of the metal or coated with it.

title: Adamantine Bar
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Adamantine Weapon
contents: text | Melee weapons made of or coated with adamantine are unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.
text | The adamantine version of a melee weapon costs 500 gp more than the normal version, whether the weapon is made of the metal or coated with it.

title: Adjustable Stilts
contents: text | The stilts take 1 minute to put on or remove. They increase the height of any humanoid wearing them by 2 to 5 feet. Each stilt weighs 8 pounds and is 1 foot long when fully collapsed.

title: Airship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 8 mphCarrying Capacity: 1 ton cargo, 20 passengersCrew 10, AC 13, HP 300
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
contents: text | This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

title: Alchemist's Supplies
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Alchemist's supplies enable a character to produce useful concoctions, such as acid or alchemist's fire.

description | Components | Alchemist's supplies include two glass beakers, a metal frame to hold a beaker in place over an open flame, a glass stirring rod, a small mortar and pestle, and a pouch of common alchemical ingredients, including salt, powdered iron, and purified water.
description | Arcana | Proficiency with alchemist's supplies allows you to unlock more information on Arcana checks involving potions and similar materials.

description | Investigation | When you inspect an area for clues, proficiency with alchemist's supplies grants additional insight into any chemicals or other substances that might have been used in the area.

description | Alchemical Crafting | You can use this tool proficiency to create alchemical items. A character can spend money to collect raw materials, which weigh 1 pound for every 50 gp spent. The DM can allow a character to make a check using the indicated skill with advantage. As part of a long rest, you can use alchemist's supplies to make one dose of acid, alchemist's fire, antitoxin, oil, perfume, or soap. Subtract half the value of the created item from the total gp worth of raw materials you are carrying.
text | Create a puff of thick smoke｜10
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Amulet
contents: text | A cleric or paladin can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Antitoxin (vial)
contents: text | A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

title: Arcane Focus
contents: text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Artisan's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Assassin's Blood
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't poisoned.

title: Backpack
contents: text | A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

title: Backpack Parachute
contents: text | A humanoid wearing this piece of gear can deploy the parachute as a reaction while falling, or as an action otherwise. The parachute requires at least a 10-foot cube of unoccupied space in which to deploy, and it doesn't open fast enough to slow a fall of less than 60 feet. If it has sufficient time and space to deploy properly, the parachute allows its wearer to land without taking falling damage. Once it has been used, the parachute takes 10 minutes to repack.

title: Bagpipes
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

title: Ball Bearing
contents: text | Most commonly found inside a bag of ball bearings.

title: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
contents: text | As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level area 10 feet square. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

title: Barding
contents: text | Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body. Any type of armor shown on the Armor table in this chapter can be purchased as barding. The cost is four times the equivalent armor made for humanoids, and it weighs twice as much.

title: Barking Box
contents: text | This metal cube, 6 inches on a side, has a crank on top. Using an action to wind the crank activates the box for 8 hours. While activated, the box barks whenever it detects vibrations within 15 feet of it, as long as the box and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. A switch on one side of the box sets the device to emit either a small dog's bark or a large dog's bark.

title: Barrel
contents: text | A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid or 4 cubic feet of solids.

title: Basic Fishing Equipment
contents: text | Basic Fishing Equipment includes a pole, a line, a hook, and either a lure or some bait.

text | Fishing is a popular pastime in Wildspace and the Astral Sea, though this activity isn't possible aboard a ship that is moving faster than its flying speed. At the end of each hour spent fishing, a character can make a DC 15 Wisdom (Survival) check. A failed check indicates no fish is caught during that hour. On a successful check, roll a d10 and consult the Fishing table to determine the catch.
text | 1–2｜Tiny, inedible fish (a creature that consumes it is poisoned for 1 hour)
text | 6–8｜Small, edible fish (feeds up to four people)
text | 9｜Hostile space eel (see Boo's Astral Menagerie; feeds up to twelve people)
text | 10｜Hostile gray scavver (see Boo's Astral Menagerie; feeds up to twenty people), some other creature of the DM's choosing, or an Tiny object of the DM's choosing

title: Basic Poison (vial)
contents: text | You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

title: Basket
contents: text | A basket holds 2 cubic feet or 40 pounds of gear.

title: Battleaxe
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Biza's Breath
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature must use its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no other creature within its reach, the poisoned creature does nothing on its turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Black Ghost Orchid Seed
contents: text | Every few years, a ghost orchid colony grows a black pod as thick as a human fist that holds three soft, black seeds. A creature that consumes one of these black seeds is affected by the spell feign death. If the creature is unaware of the pod's effects or does not wish to be affected, it can resist the effect by succeeding on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. Otherwise, it is considered to be a willing recipient of the spell.

title: Block and Tackle
contents: text | A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

title: Blowgun
contents: description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Loading | Can fire only once regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

title: Bombard
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4 mphCarrying Capacity: 150 tons cargoCrew 12, AC 15, HP 300, Damage Threshold 20

text | Bombards are built by giff. The major feature of each ship is an enormous cannon that fires massive cannon balls capable of blowing other ships to smithereens. (The cannon is included in the cost of the ship.) A bombard can carry up to fourteen giant cannon balls, each of which weighs 10 tons. These cannon balls make up most of the weight of the ship's cargo. A winch mounted on the aft deck is used to load the cannon balls on board.
text | A bombard can float and sail on water, but it can't land safely on the ground (its keel would cause it to roll on its side).

title: Book
contents: text | A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

title: Breastplate
contents: text | This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

title: Brewer's Supplies
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.

text | Brewing is the art of producing beer. Not only does beer serve as an alcoholic beverage, but the process of brewing purifies water. Crafting beer takes weeks of fermentation, but only a few hours of work.
description | Components | Brewer's supplies include a large glass jug, a quantity of hops, a siphon, and several feet of tubing.
description | History | Proficiency with brewer's supplies gives you additional insight on Intelligence (History) checks concerning events that involve alcohol as a significant element.
description | Medicine | This tool proficiency grants additional insight when you treat anyone suffering from alcohol poisoning or when you can use alcohol to dull pain.

description | Persuasion | A stiff drink can help soften the hardest heart. Your proficiency with brewer's supplies can help you ply someone with drink, giving them just enough alcohol to mellow their mood.

description | Potable Water | Your knowledge of brewing enables you to purify water that would otherwise be undrinkable. As part of a long rest, you can purify up to 6 gallons of water, or 1 gallon as part of a short rest.
text | Detect poison or impurities in a drink｜10
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Bucket
contents: text | A bucket holds 3 gallons of liquid or ½ cubic foot of solids.

title: Bullseye Lantern
contents: text | A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

title: Burglar's Pack
contents: bullet | a bag of 1,000 ball bearings

title: Burnt Othur Fumes
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the character takes 3 (1d6) poison damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

title: Calligrapher's Supplies
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.

text | Calligraphy treats writing as a delicate, beautiful art. Calligraphers produce text that is pleasing to the eye, using a style that is difficult to forge. Their supplies also give them some ability to examine scripts and determine if they are legitimate, since a calligrapher's training involves long hours of studying writing and attempting to replicate its style and design.
description | Components | Calligrapher's supplies include ink, a dozen sheets of parchment, and three quills.

description | Arcana | Although calligraphy is of little help in deciphering the content of magical writings, proficiency with these supplies can aid in identifying who wrote a script of a magical nature.

description | History | This tool proficiency can augment the benefit of successful checks made to analyze or investigate ancient writings, scrolls, or other texts, including runes etched in stone or messages in frescoes or other displays.

description | Decipher Treasure Map | This tool proficiency grants you expertise in examining maps. You can make an Intelligence check to determine a map's age, whether a map includes any hidden messages, or similar facts.
text | Identify writer of nonmagical script｜10
text | Determine writer's state of mind｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Caltrop
contents: text | As an action, you can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

title: Caltrops (bag of 20)
contents: text | As an action, you can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

title: Camel
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 50, Carrying Capacity: 480 lb.

title: Candle
contents: text | For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

title: Canoe
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 2 mphCarrying Capacity: 6 passengersCrew 1, AC 11, HP 50
text | A canoe can be purchased in Port Nyanzaru for 50 gp. It holds up to six Medium creatures and has a maximum speed of 2 mph. It is otherwise identical to a rowboat.
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Canvas (1 sq. yd.)
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Carpenter's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Skill at carpentry enables a character to construct wooden structures. A carpenter can build a house, a shack, a wooden cabinet, or similar items.
description | Components | Carpenter's tools include a saw, a hammer, nails, a hatchet, a square, a ruler, an adze, a plane, and a chisel.
description | History | This tool proficiency aids you in identifying the use and the origin of wooden buildings and other large wooden objects.
description | Investigation | You gain additional insight when inspecting areas within wooden structures, because you know tricks of construction that can conceal areas from discovery.
description | Perception | You can spot irregularities in wooden walls or floors, making it easier to find trap doors and secret passages.
description | Stealth | You can quickly assess the weak spots in a wooden floor, making it easier to avoid the places that creak and groan when they're stepped on.
description | Fortify | With 1 minute of work and raw materials, you can make a door or window harder to force open. Increase the DC needed to open it by 5.

description | Temporary Shelter | As part of a long rest, you can construct a lean-to or a similar shelter to keep your group dry and in the shade for the duration of the rest. Because it was fashioned quickly from whatever wood was available, the shelter collapses 1d3 days after being assembled.
text | Build a simple wooden structure｜10
text | Design a complex wooden structure｜15
text | Find a weak point in a wooden wall｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Carrion Crawler Mucus
contents: text | This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated carrion crawler. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Cartographer's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.

text | Using cartographer's tools, you can create accurate maps to make travel easier for yourself and those who come after you. These maps can range from large-scale depictions of mountain ranges to diagrams that show the layout of a dungeon level.
description | Components | Cartographer's tools consist of a quill, ink, parchment, a pair of compasses, calipers, and a ruler.

description | Arcana, History, Religion | You can use your knowledge of maps and locations to unearth more detailed information when you use these skills. For instance, you might spot hidden messages in a map, identify when the map was made to determine if geographical features have changed since then, and so forth.
description | Nature | Your familiarity with physical geography makes it easier for you to answer questions or solve issues relating to the terrain around you.

description | Survival | Your understanding of geography makes it easier to find paths to civilization, to predict areas where villages or towns might be found, and to avoid becoming lost. You have studied so many maps that common patterns, such as how trade routes evolve and where settlements arise in relation to geographic locations, are familiar to you.
description | Craft a Map | While traveling, you can draw a map as you go in addition to engaging in other activity.
text | Determine a map's age and origin｜10
text | Estimate direction and distance to a landmark｜15
text | Discern that a map is fake｜15
text | Fill in a missing part of a map｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Chain (10 feet)
contents: text | A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

title: Chain Mail
contents: text | Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.
text | Speed reduced by 10 feet if Strength score less than 13.

title: Chain Shirt
contents: text | Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

title: Chariot
contents: text | Chariots and the creatures pulling them work like controlled mounts, as described in the mounted combat rules in the Player's Handbook, but with the following differences:
bullet | Mounting or dismounting a chariot costs you 5 feet of movement, rather than a number of feet equal to half your speed.
bullet | Being mounted on a chariot grants you half cover.
bullet | A chariot's speed is equal to the speed of the slowest creature pulling it.
bullet | If multiple creatures are pulling the chariot, they all act on the same initiative, and they must take the same action on their turn.

title: Chest
contents: text | A chest holds 12 cubic feet or 300 pounds of gear.

title: Chicken
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Cinnamon
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Climber's Kit
contents: text | A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

title: Cloves
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Club
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon

title: Cobbler's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Although the cobbler's trade might seem too humble for an adventurer, a good pair of boots will see a character across rugged wilderness and through deadly dungeons.
description | Components | Cobbler's tools consist of a hammer, an awl, a knife, a shoe stand, a cutter, spare leather, and thread.
description | Arcana, History | Your knowledge of shoes aids you in identifying the magical properties of enchanted boots or the history of such items.

description | Investigation | Footwear holds a surprising number of secrets. You can learn where someone has recently visited by examining the wear and the dirt that has accumulated on their shoes. Your experience in repairing shoes makes it easier for you to identify where damage might come from.

description | Maintain Shoes | As part of a long rest, you can repair your companions' shoes. For the next 24 hours, up to six creatures of your choice who wear shoes you worked on can travel up to 10 hours a day without making saving throws to avoid exhaustion.

description | Craft Hidden Compartment | With 8 hours of work, you can add a hidden compartment to a pair of shoes. The compartment can hold an object up to 3 inches long and 1 inch wide and deep. You make an Intelligence check using your tool proficiency to determine the Intelligence (Investigation) check DC needed to find the compartment.
text | Determine a shoe's age and origin｜10
text | Find a hidden compartment in a boot heel｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Component Pouch
contents: text | A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

title: Cook's Utensils
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Adventuring is a hard life. With a cook along on the journey, your meals will be much better than the typical mix of hardtack and dried fruit.
description | Components | Cook's utensils include a metal pot, knives, forks, a stirring spoon, and a ladle.
description | History | Your knowledge of cooking techniques allows you to assess the social patterns involved in a culture's eating habits.
description | Medicine | When administering treatment, you can transform medicine that is bitter or sour into a pleasing concoction.
description | Survival | When foraging for food, you can make do with ingredients you scavenge that others would be unable to transform into nourishing meals.

description | Prepare Meals | As part of a short rest, you can prepare a tasty meal that helps your companions regain their strength. You and up to five creatures of your choice regain 1 extra hit point per Hit Die spent during a short rest, provided you have access to your cook's utensils and sufficient food.
text | Spot poison or impurities in food｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Copper
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Cotton Cloth (1 sq. yd.)
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Cow
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Crossbow Bolt Case
contents: text | This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

title: Crowbar
contents: text | Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

title: Crystal
contents: text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Dagger
contents: property | Properties | Finesse, light, thrown (20/60 ft.)
property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Damselfly Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 8 mphCarrying Capacity: 5 tons cargoCrew 9, AC 19, HP 200, Damage Threshold 15

text | This swift but cramped ship is made mostly of metal. It can't float on water, but its legs enable it to land safely on the ground. A sliding hatch just behind the wings allows access to the ship's mangonel turret. The ship's cargo hold can easily be turned into crew cabins or another weapon deck.

text | Damselfly ships are often used as courier vessels and armored transports. Explorers and pirates like them because they're fast and sturdy. Military leaders use them as command ships for the same reasons.

text | Damselfly ship owners are a proud lot, fond of painting their ships in colorful patterns as well as customizing their vessels with special equipment. Large, private gatherings of damselfly ship owners are not uncommon; they use these get-togethers to show off their ships and to race one another through asteroid belts and other obstacle courses, either for rewards or bragging rights.

title: Dart
contents: description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Dice Set
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.
description | Components | A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.
description | History | Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.
description | Insight | Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

description | Sleight of Hand | Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.
text | Gain insight into an opponent's personality｜15

title: Diplomat's Pack
contents: bullet | 2 cases for maps and scrolls
bullet | a set of fine clothes

title: Disguise Kit
contents: text | This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.
text | The perfect tool for anyone who wants to engage in trickery, a disguise kit enables its owner to adopt a false identity.
description | Components | A disguise kit includes cosmetics, hair dye, small props, and a few pieces of clothing.
description | Deception | In certain cases, a disguise can improve your ability to weave convincing lies.

description | Intimidation | The right disguise can make you look more fearsome, whether you want to scare someone away by posing as a plague victim or intimidate a gang of thugs by taking the appearance of a bully.
description | Performance | A cunning disguise can enhance an audience's enjoyment of a performance, provided the disguise is properly designed to evoke the desired reaction.
description | Persuasion | Folk tend to trust a person in uniform. If you disguise yourself as an authority figure, your efforts to persuade others are often more effective.

description | Create Disguise | As part of a long rest, you can create a disguise. It takes you 1 minute to don such a disguise once you have created it. You can carry only one such disguise on you at a time without drawing undue attention, unless you have a bag of holding or a similar method to keep them hidden. Each disguise weighs 1 pound.
text | At other times, it takes 10 minutes to craft a disguise that involves moderate changes to your appearance, and 30 minutes for one that requires more extensive changes.
text | Cover injuries or distinguishing marks｜10
text | Spot a disguise being used by someone else｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Donkey
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 40, Carrying Capacity: 420 lb.

title: Draft Horse
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 40, Carrying Capacity: 540 lb.

title: Dragonchess Set
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.
description | Components | A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.
description | History | Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.
description | Insight | Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

description | Sleight of Hand | Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.

title: Drow Poison
contents: text | This poison is typically made only by the drow, and only in a place far removed from sunlight. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

Players whose characters have the feylost or Witchlight hand background can roll on this table instead of the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook to determine what trinkets their characters possess. The adventure includes a few encounters that require you to roll on the table to determine what random trinkets the characters find in key locations.

title: Flying Fish Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4½ mphCarrying Capacity: 13 tons cargoCrew 10, AC 15, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15
text | Aside from space galleons, flying fish ships are the most common vessels in Wildspace, favorites among merchants and adventurers alike.

text | A flying fish ship can float and sail on water, but it isn't built to land on the ground (the ventral fins would snap under the weight of the ship during landing, and the keel would cause the ship to roll to one side).
text | Typical weapons on a flying fish ship include a forward-mounted mangonel and an aftmounted ballista.

title: Forgery Kit
contents: text | This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document.
text | A forgery kit is designed to duplicate documents and to make it easier to copy a person's seal or signature.

description | Components | A forgery kit includes several different types of ink, a variety of parchments and papers, several quills, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and small tools to sculpt melted wax to mimic a seal.
description | Arcana | A forgery kit can be used in conjunction with the Arcana skill to determine if a magic item is real or fake.
description | Deception | A well-crafted forgery, such as papers proclaiming you to be a noble or a writ that grants you safe passage, can lend credence to a lie.
description | History | A forgery kit combined with your knowledge of history improves your ability to create fake historical documents or to tell if an old document is authentic.
description | Investigation | When you examine objects, proficiency with a forgery kit is useful for determining how an object was made and whether it is genuine.

description | Other Tools | Knowledge of other tools makes your forgeries that much more believable. For example, you could combine proficiency with a forgery kit and proficiency with cartographer's tools to make a fake map.

description | Quick Fake | As part of a short rest, you can produce a forged document no more than one page in length. As part of a long rest, you can produce a document that is up to four pages long. Your Intelligence check using a forgery kit determines the DC for someone else's Intelligence (Investigation) check to spot the fake.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Galley
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4 mphCarrying Capacity: 150 tons cargoCrew 80, AC 15, HP 500, Damage Threshold 20
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Gaming Set
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.
description | Components | A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.
description | History | Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.
description | Insight | Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

description | Sleight of Hand | Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.

title: Glassblower's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Someone who is proficient with glassblower's tools has not only the ability to shape glass, but also specialized knowledge of the methods used to produce glass objects.
description | Components | The tools include a blowpipe, a small marver, blocks, and tweezers. You need a source of heat to work glass.

description | Arcana, History | Your knowledge of glassmaking techniques aids you when you examine glass objects, such as potion bottles or glass items found in a treasure hoard. For instance, you can study how a glass potion bottle has been changed by its contents to help determine a potion's effects. (A potion might leave behind a residue, deform the glass, or stain it.)
description | Investigation | When you study an area, your knowledge can aid you if the clues include broken glass or glass objects.
description | Identify Weakness | With 1 minute of study, you can identify the weak points in a glass object. Any damage dealt to the object by striking a weak spot is doubled.
text | Determine what a glass object once held｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

contents: text | Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

title: Hammerhead Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4 mphCarrying Capacity: 30 tons cargoCrew 15, AC 15, HP 400, Damage Threshold 15

text | Hammerhead ships are popular craft, especially among pirates and merchants carrying heavy cargo. They can float on water and sail across it, but they aren't built to land on the ground (their keels would cause them to tip to one side). Standard weapons on a hammerhead ship include fore and aft mangonels, a ballista, and a reinforced bow for ramming.

title: Hand Crossbow
contents: property | Properties | Ammunition (30/120 ft.), light, loading
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Loading | Can fire only once regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

title: Handaxe
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Healer's Kit
contents: text | This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

title: Heavy Crossbow
contents: property | Properties | Ammunition (100/400 ft.), heavy, loading, two-handed
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.

description | Heavy | Small/Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls.
description | Loading | Can fire only once regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Hempen Rope (50 feet)
contents: text | Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

title: Herbalism Kit
contents: text | This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing.
text | Proficiency with an herbalism kit allows you to identify plants and safely collect their useful elements.
description | Components | An herbalism kit includes pouches to store herbs, clippers and leather gloves for collecting plants, a mortar and pestle, and several glass jars.
description | Arcana | Your knowledge of the nature and uses of herbs can add insight to your magical studies that deal with plants and your attempts to identify potions.
description | Investigation | When you inspect an area overgrown with plants, your proficiency can help you pick out details and clues that others might miss.
description | Medicine | Your mastery of herbalism improves your ability to treat illnesses and wounds by augmenting your methods of care with medicinal plants.
description | Nature and Survival | When you travel in the wild, your skill in herbalism makes it easier to identify plants and spot sources of food that others might overlook.
description | Identify Plants | You can identify most plants with a quick inspection of their appearance and smell.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Hide Armor
contents: text | This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

title: Holy Symbol
contents: text | A cleric or paladin can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Holy Water (flask)
contents: text | As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage.

text | A cleric or paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

title: Hooded Lantern
contents: text | A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

title: Hooked Shortspear
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon

text | On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

title: Horn
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

title: Hunting Trap
contents: text | When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

title: Insect Repellent (block of incense)
contents: text | Insect repellent can be purchased in Port Nyanzaru in two forms: blocks of incense or a greasy salve. The merchant prince Kwayothe controls the sale of both. Neither kind of repellent protects against giant insects or the vile swarms of insects described in appendix A of the Monster Manual.
text | When lit, it burns for 8 hours and repels normal insects within a 20-foot-radius centered on it.

title: Insect Repellent (greasy salve)
contents: text | Insect repellent can be purchased in Port Nyanzaru in two forms: blocks of incense or a greasy salve. The merchant prince Kwayothe controls the sale of both. Neither kind of repellent protects against giant insects or the vile swarms of insects described in appendix A of the Monster Manual.

text | A gourd or vial of salve contains 20 applications of odorless grease. One application protects its wearer against normal insects for 24 hours. The salve is waterproof so it doesn't wash off in rain.

title: Iron
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Iron Pot
contents: text | An iron pot holds 1 gallon of liquid.

title: Javelin
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Jeweler's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Training with jeweler's tools includes the basic techniques needed to beautify gems. It also gives you expertise in identifying precious stones.
description | Components | Jeweler's tools consist of a small saw and hammer, files, pliers, and tweezers.

description | Arcana | Proficiency with jeweler's tools grants you knowledge about the reputed mystical uses of gems. This insight proves handy when you make Arcana checks related to gems or gem-encrusted items.
description | Investigation | When you inspect jeweled objects, your proficiency with jeweler's tools aids you in picking out clues they might hold.
description | Identify Gems | You can identify gems and determine their value at a glance.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Jug
contents: text | A jug holds 1 gallon of liquid.

title: Keelboat
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 1 mphCarrying Capacity: 1/2 ton cargo, 6 passengersCrew 1, AC 15, HP 100, Damage Threshold 10

text | Keelboats and rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores.
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Keg of Alchemist's Fire
contents: text | A keg of alchemist's fire lobbed at a creature or an object deals 21 (6d6) fire damage on a hit. Further, the target is set ablaze and takes the damage again every round (in the case of a creature, at the start of each of its turns) until the fire is put out. A creature within reach of the blaze can take an action to smother the flames using a blanket or carpet, reducing the fire damage by 2d6. Three such actions are needed to fully put out the fire.

title: Lamp
contents: text | A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

title: Lamprey Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4 mphCarrying Capacity: 6 tons cargoCrew 15, AC 15, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15
text | Lamprey ships are antiquated, being among the oldest spelljamming ships still in use. Psurlons (see Boo's Astral Menagerie) are particularly fond of them.

text | Using the metal grappling jaws built into its bow, a lamprey ship can attach itself to another ship, which is a critical feature during boarding actions. Other standard weapons include four ballistae on the main deck.

text | A lamprey can float on water, though it can't land safely on the ground. Lamprey ships that land on the ground have the distressing habit of rolling over, as more than a few crews have discovered to their dismay.

title: Lance
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Special | You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.
description | Reach | Adds 5 feet to your reach.

title: Leather Armor
contents: text | The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

title: Leatherworker's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Knowledge of leatherworking extends to lore concerning animal hides and their properties. It also confers knowledge of leather armor and similar goods.
description | Components | Leatherworker's tools include a knife, a small mallet, an edger, a hole punch, thread, and leather scraps.
description | Arcana | Your expertise in working with leather grants you added insight when you inspect magic items crafted from leather, such as boots and some cloaks.
description | Investigation | You gain added insight when studying leather items or clues related to them, as you draw on your knowledge of leather to pick out details that others would overlook.

description | Identify Hides | When looking at a hide or a leather item, you can determine the source of the leather and any special techniques used to treat it. For example, you can spot the difference between leather crafted using dwarven methods and leather crafted using halfling methods.
text | Modify a leather item's appearance｜10
text | Determine a leather item's history｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Light Crossbow
contents: property | Properties | Ammunition (80/320 ft.), loading, two-handed
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Loading | Can fire only once regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Light Hammer
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Light Repeating Crossbow
contents: text | This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Linen (1 sq. yd.)
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Living Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4½ mphCarrying Capacity: 10 tons cargoCrew 5, AC 15, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15

text | Druids, rangers, and clerics devoted to gods of nature are often found aboard living ships, as are Wildspace explorers who don't want to have to worry about their ship's air envelope becoming fouled during a long voyage.

text | This ship's main distinctive feature is the fully grown treant on the aft deck. The treant has a speed of 0 because its roots are woven into the deck; it and the ship are inseparable. If the ship is reduced to 0 hit points, the treant dies of shock. The ship can function if its treant dies, but the treant can never be replaced with another.

text | When the treant finishes a long rest, it repairs the ship's hull, enabling the ship to regain 4d12 hit points, and refreshes the ship's air envelope (turning deadly air into foul air, or foul air into fresh air).
text | A living ship can float on water and sail across it, but it can't land safely on the ground (its keel would cause it to roll on its side). Its standard weaponry is an aft-mounted ballista.

title: Lock
contents: text | A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your DM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

title: Longbow
contents: property | Properties | Ammunition (150/600 ft.), heavy, two-handed
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Heavy | Small/Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls.
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Longship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 3 mphCarrying Capacity: 10 tons cargo, 150 passengersCrew 40, AC 15, HP 300, Damage Threshold 15
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Longsword
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Lute
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

title: Mace
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon

title: Magnifying Glass
contents: text | This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

title: Malice
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. The poisoned creature is blinded.

title: Manacles
contents: text | These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

title: Map or Scroll Case
contents: text | This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

title: Mason's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Mason's tools allow you to craft stone structures, including walls and buildings crafted from brick.
description | Components | Mason's tools consist of a trowel, a hammer, a chisel, brushes, and a square.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in identifying a stone building's date of construction and purpose, along with insight into who might have built it.
description | Investigation | You gain additional insight when inspecting areas within stone structures.
description | Perception | You can spot irregularities in stone walls or floors, making it easier to find trap doors and secret passages.
description | Demolition | Your knowledge of masonry allows you to spot weak points in brick walls. You deal double damage to such structures with your weapon attacks.
text | Chisel a small hole in a stone wall｜10
text | Find a weak point in a stone wall｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Mastiff
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 40, Carrying Capacity: 195 lb.

title: Matchless Pipe
contents: text | A switch made of flint is built into the bowl of this fine wooden smoking pipe. With a few flicks of the switch, the pipe lights itself.

title: Maul
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Heavy | Small/Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls.
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Menga leaves (1 ounce)
contents: text | The dried leaves of a menga bush can be ground, dissolved in a liquid, heated, and ingested. A creature that ingests 1 ounce of menga leaves in this fashion regains 1 hit point. A creature that ingests more than 5 ounces of menga leaves in a 24-hour period gains no additional benefit and must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 hour. The unconscious creature awakens if it takes at least 5 damage on one turn.
text | A healthy menga bush usually has 2d6 ounces of leaves. Once picked, the leaves require 1 day to dry out before they can confer any benefit.

title: Merchant's Scale
contents: text | A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

title: Mess Kit
contents: text | This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

title: Midnight Tears
contents: text | A creature that ingests this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (9d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Military Saddle
contents: text | A military saddle braces the rider, helping you keep your seat on an active mount in battle. It gives you advantage on any check you make to remain mounted.

title: Morningstar
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon

title: Mule
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 40, Carrying Capacity: 420 lb.

title: Nautiloid
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4½ mphCarrying Capacity: 17 tons cargoCrew 20, AC 15, HP 400, Damage Threshold 15
text | Built and used by mind flayers, nautiloids are designed exclusively for space travel. They can't float on water, nor can they land safely on the ground.

text | As an action, a creature attuned to a nautiloid's spelljamming helm and in physical contact with the ship can transport the nautiloid and all creatures and objects aboard it to a different plane of existence, at or near a destination envisioned by the spelljammer (or to a random location on the plane if no destination is envisioned). This property is a feature of the ship, not the spelljamming helm. Each time this property is used, roll a d6. On a 5–6, the property recharges after 1 minute; otherwise, it can't be used again for 24 hours.

title: Navigator's Tools
contents: text | This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.
text | Proficiency with navigator's tools helps you determine a true course based on observing the stars. It also grants you insight into charts and maps while developing your sense of direction.
description | Components | Navigator's tools include a sextant, a compass, calipers, a ruler, parchment, ink, and a quill.
description | Survival | Knowledge of navigator's tools helps you avoid becoming lost and also grants you insight into the most likely location for roads and settlements.
description | Sighting | By taking careful measurements, you can determine your position on a nautical chart and the time of day.
text | Discover your position on a nautical chart｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Net
contents: description | Special | A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

title: Nightspider
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4½ mphCarrying Capacity: 50 tons cargoCrew 25, AC 19, HP 300, Damage Threshold 15

text | Neogi terrorize Wildspace in ships of their own construction, which others call nightspiders. These vessels often wait in ambush for other ships. Once a target ship is identified, the neogi try to steal its spelljamming helm and capture its crew.
text | A nightspider's crew usually consists of nineteen neogi and up to a half-dozen umber hulks, which the neogi use as shock troops.

text | Nightspiders are designed for space travel alone and can't float on water or land safely on the ground (the weight of the ship would snap its spindly legs, destroying its weblike rigging in the process). Standard weaponry on a nightspider includes four ballistae (two forward-facing and two aft-facing) and a forward-facing mangonel.

title: Nimblewright Detector
contents: text | To activate the nimblewright detector, a character must hold down its trigger. When the activated device comes within 500 feet of a nimblewright other than Nim, the umbrella begins to spin, whir, and click. The spinning, whirring, and clicking accelerates as the distance to the target lessens, reaching maximum velocity and volume when a nimblewright other than Nim is within 30 feet of the device.

title: Oil (flask)
contents: text | Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

title: Oil of Taggit
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 24 hours. The poisoned creature is unconscious. The creature wakes up if it takes damage.

title: Orb
contents: text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

contents: property | Properties | Ammunition (150/600 ft.), heavy, two-handed

text | This unique weapon can be used only by a Medium or larger creature that has a Strength of 18 or higher. The bow shoots oversized arrows that deal piercing damage equal to 2d6 + the wielder's Strength modifier.

contents: text | Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

title: Painter's Supplies
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Proficiency with painter's supplies represents your ability to paint and draw. You also acquire an understanding of art history, which can aid you in examining works of art.
description | Components | Painter's supplies include an easel, canvas, paints, brushes, charcoal sticks, and a palette.

description | Arcana, History, Religion | Your expertise aids you in uncovering lore of any sort that is attached to a work of art, such as the magical properties of a painting or the origins of a strange mural found in a dungeon.
description | Investigation, Perception | When you inspect a painting or a similar work of visual art, your knowledge of the practices behind creating it can grant you additional insight.

description | Painting and Drawing | As part of a short or long rest, you can produce a simple work of art. Although your work might lack precision, you can capture an image or a scene, or make a quick copy of a piece of art you saw.
text | Create a painting with a hidden message｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Pale Tincture
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage and become poisoned. The poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw every 24 hours, taking 3 (1d6) poison damage on a failed save. Until this poison ends, the damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means. After seven successful saving throws, the effect ends and the creature can heal normally.

title: Pan Flute
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
