description | Reach | Adds 5 feet to your reach.
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Pitcher
contents: text | A pitcher holds 1 gallon of liquid.

title: Plate Armor
contents: text | Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
text | Speed reduced by 10 feet if Strength score less than 15.

title: Platinum
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Playing Card Set
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.
description | Components | A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.
description | History | Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.
description | Insight | Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

description | Sleight of Hand | Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.
text | Gain insight into an opponent's personality｜15

title: Poisoner's Kit
contents: text | A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.
text | Additionally, the Crafting and Harvesting Poison rules require the use of a poisoner's kit.

text | A poisoner's kit is a favored resource for thieves, assassins, and others who engage in skulduggery. It allows you to apply poisons and create them from various materials. Your knowledge of poisons also helps you treat them.
description | Components | A poisoner's kit includes glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod.
description | History | Your training with poisons can help you when you try to recall facts about infamous poisonings.

description | Investigation, Perception | Your knowledge of poisons has taught you to handle those substances carefully, giving you an edge when you inspect poisoned objects or try to extract clues from events that involve poison.
description | Medicine | When you treat the victim of a poison, your knowledge grants you added insight into how to provide the best care to your patient.
description | Nature, Survival | Working with poisons enables you to acquire lore about which plants and animals are poisonous.
description | Handle Poison | Your proficiency allows you to handle and apply a poison without risk of exposing yourself to its effects.
text | Determine the effects of a poison｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Pony
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 40, Carrying Capacity: 225 lb.

title: Portable Ram
contents: text | You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

title: Potter's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Potter's tools are used to create a variety of ceramic objects, most typically pots and similar vessels.
description | Components | Potter's tools include potter's needles, ribs, scrapers, a knife, and calipers.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in identifying ceramic objects, including when they were created and their likely place or culture of origin.
description | Investigation, Perception | You gain additional insight when inspecting ceramics, uncovering clues others would overlook by spotting minor irregularities.
description | Reconstruction | By examining pottery shards, you can determine an object's original, intact form and its likely purpose.
text | Determine what a vessel once held｜10
text | Find a weak point in a ceramic object｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Pouch
contents: text | A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold up to ⅕ cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

title: Purple Worm Poison
contents: text | This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated purple worm. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Quarterstaff
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Quiver
contents: text | A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

title: Rain Catcher
contents: text | A rain catcher is a simple contraption consisting of a 5-foot-square leather tarp and a wooden frame with legs. When the tarp is stretched across the wooden frame, it forms a basin that can catch 2 gallons of drinking water per inch of rainfall and hold up to 8 gallons. The tarp and wooden frame fold up for easy transport.

title: Rapier
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.

title: Rations (1 day)
contents: text | Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

title: Reliquary
contents: text | A cleric or paladin can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Riding Horse
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 60, Carrying Capacity: 480 lb.

title: Ring Mail
contents: text | This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

title: Rod
contents: text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Rowboat
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 1½ mphCarrying Capacity: 3 passengersCrew 1, AC 11, HP 50

text | Keelboats and rowboats are used on lakes and rivers, If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A rowboat weighs 100 pounds, in case adventurers carry it over land.
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.

title: Ryath Root
contents: text | Any creature that ingests a ryath root gains 2d4 temporary hit points. A creature that consumes more than one ryath root in a 24-hour period must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or suffer the poisoned condition for 1 hour.

title: Sack
contents: text | A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

title: Scale Mail
contents: text | This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

title: Scholar's Pack
contents: bullet | a little bag of sand

title: Scimitar
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.

title: Scorpion Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 3½ mphCarrying Capacity: 12 tons cargoCrew 12, AC 19, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15

text | Scorpion ships are archaic metal warships that have never lost their popularity, largely because of their versatility. Articulated legs enable a scorpion ship to land safely on the ground and move across a solid surface at a walking speed of 30 feet. The ship can't float on water, however. A ballista is mounted on the top deck, and a mangonel is perched on the end of the tail. The ship's two claws are relatively inefficient in combat, but a claw that grabs a creature can quickly take it out of action.

title: Serpent Venom
contents: text | This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated giant poisonous snake. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Shatterstick
contents: text | A shatterstick is a nonmagical, 12-inch-long, 4-pound stake made of blue-tinged infernal iron mined on Cania, the eighth layer of the Nine Hells. When embedded in earth or pounded into solid rock, the stake emits a seismic vibration in a 20-foot radius centered on itself for 1 minute, shaking the ground in that area for the duration. When the effects ends, the shatterstick breaks apart, becoming useless, and all structures within 20 feet of it take 35 (10d6) bludgeoning damage.

title: Shawm

text | Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

title: Sheep
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Shield
contents: text | A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

title: Shortbow
contents: description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).
description | Two-Handed | Requires two hands to attack with.

title: Shortsword
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.

title: Shrike Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 8 mphCarrying Capacity: 20 tons cargoCrew 11, AC 15, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15

text | This swift vessel is a relatively recent design, quickly gaining popularity with merchants and pirates. A shrike ship's legs enable it to land safely on the ground. The ship can float but isn't built for traveling on water and sinks quickly in rough seas.

text | Standard weaponry on a shrike ship includes three ballistae—one on the forecastle, one in the middle of the top deck, and one on the sterncastle. In a desperate situation, the ship's reinforced bow can be used as a piercing ram.

title: Sickle
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon

title: Silk (1 sq. yd.)
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Silk Rope (50 feet)
contents: text | Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

title: Silver
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Silvered Ammunition
contents: text | Some monsters that have immunity or resistance to nonmagical weapons are susceptible to silver ammunition, so cautious adventurers invest extra coin to plate their ammunition in silver. You can silver ten pieces of ammunition for 100 gp. This cost represents not only the price of the silver, but the time and expertise needed to add silver to the ammunition without making it less effective.

title: Silvered Weapon
contents: text | Some monsters that have immunity or resistance to nonmagical weapons are susceptible to silver weapons, so cautious adventurers invest extra coin to plate their weapons with silver. You can silver a single weapon for 100 gp. This cost represents not only the price of the silver, but the time and expertise needed to add silver to the weapon without making it less effective.

title: Sinda berries (10)
contents: text | These berries are dark brown and bitter. A full-grown sinda berry bush has 4d6 berries growing on it. A bush plucked of all its berries grows new berries in 1d4 months. Picked berries lose their freshness and efficacy after 24 hours.

text | Fresh sinda berries can be eaten raw or crushed and added to a drink to dull the bitterness. A creature that consumes at least ten fresh sinda berries gains advantage on saving throws against disease and poison for the next 24 hours.

title: Sling
contents: description | Range | Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.
description | Ammunition | Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
text | Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).

title: Smith's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Smith's tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, repair damage, or work raw ingots into useful items.
description | Components | Smith's tools include hammers, tongs, charcoal, rags, and a whetstone.
description | Arcana and History | Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining metal objects, such as weapons.
description | Investigation | You can spot clues and make deductions that others might overlook when an investigation involves armor, weapons, or other metalwork.
description | Repair | With access to your tools and an open flame hot enough to make metal pliable, you can restore 10 hit points to a damaged metal object for each hour of work.
text | Repair a suit of armor｜15
text | Sunder a nonmagical metal object｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Space Galleon
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4 mphCarrying Capacity: 20 tons cargoCrew 20, AC 15, HP 400, Damage Threshold 15

text | The space galleon is a mainstay among the host of vessels that ply Wildspace and the Astral Sea. Space galleons can easily pass for ordinary seafaring galleons. Because they can land on water and move across it like their namesakes, they can sail into ports on terrestrial worlds without attracting undue attention. Like an ordinary galleon, a space galleon isn't built to land on the ground (its keel would cause it to roll on its side). The ship's standard weaponry includes two forward-mounted ballistae and an aft-mounted mangonel.

title: Spear
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Spellbook
contents: text | Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

title: Splint Armor
contents: text | This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.
text | Speed reduced by 10 feet if Strength score less than 15.

title: Sprig of Mistletoe
contents: text | A druid can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Spyglass
contents: text | Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

title: Squid Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 3½ mphCarrying Capacity: 20 tons cargoCrew 13, AC 15, HP 300, Damage Threshold 15

text | Among the oldest types of spelljamming vessels, squid ships are popular with privateers and are often used as patrol ships. Standard weapons on a squid ship include a forward-mounted mangonel, two aft-mounted ballistae, and a reinforced bow for ramming. The tentacles that extend from the bow account for nearly half the ship's keel length.
text | Squid ships can float and sail on water, and they can land on the ground.

title: Staff
contents: property | Type | Simple weapon, melee weapon
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.
text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Star Moth
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 5½ mphCarrying Capacity: 30 tons cargoCrew 13, AC 13, HP 400, Damage Threshold 15
text | Star moths are ships constructed and flown by astral elves, who don't like it when these ships end up in the hands of others.

text | A star moth's hull is fashioned from a grown and sculpted organic substance, and its enormous, decorative wings are made of shimmering crystal. The vessel is built for space travel, but its design does enable it to float on water or land safely on the ground. Standard weaponry includes two ballistae nestled in the star moth's eye holes and a mangonel mounted above the bridge.

title: Studded Leather Armor
contents: text | Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

title: Tangler Grenade
contents: text | A tangler grenade is an alchemical, nonmagical item with an ovoid resin shell that shatters on impact. An as action, a creature can throw a tangler grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of a shattered tangler grenade must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by sticky white webs. As an action, a creature can try to free itself or another creature within its reach from the webs, doing so with a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check. A gallon of alcohol dissolves the webs produced by a single tangler grenade. Otherwise, the webs dissolve on their own after 1 hour, freeing any creatures restrained by them.

title: Tankard
contents: text | A tankard holds 1 pint of liquid.

title: Tej
contents: text | Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It's more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale. A mug of tej costs 4 cp in Port Nyanzaru or 6 cp in Fort Beluarian. A 1-gallon cask costs 2 sp in the city or 3 sp at the fort.

title: Thieves' Tools
contents: text | This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

text | Perhaps the most common tools used by adventurers, thieves' tools are designed for picking locks and foiling traps. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of traps and locks.
description | Components | Thieves' tools include a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.
description | History | Your knowledge of traps grants you insight when answering questions about locations that are renowned for their traps.
description | Investigation and Perception | You gain additional insight when looking for traps, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

description | Set a Trap | Just as you can disable traps, you can also set them. As part of a short rest, you can create a trap using items you have on hand. The total of your check becomes the DC for someone else's attempt to discover or disable the trap. The trap deals damage appropriate to the materials used in crafting it (such as poison or a weapon) or damage equal to half the total of your check, whichever the DM deems appropriate.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Three-Dragon Ante Set
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.
description | Components | A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.
description | History | Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.
description | Insight | Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

description | Sleight of Hand | Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.
text | Gain insight into an opponent's personality｜15

title: Tinderbox
contents: text | This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

title: Tinker's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.

text | A set of tinker's tools is designed to enable you to repair many mundane objects. Though you can't manufacture much with tinker's tools, you can mend torn clothes, sharpen a worn sword, and patch a tattered suit of chain mail.
description | Components | Tinker's tools include a variety of hand tools, thread, needles, a whetstone, scraps of cloth and leather, and a small pot of glue.
description | History | You can determine the age and origin of objects, even if you have only a few pieces remaining from the original.
description | Investigation | When you inspect a damaged object, you gain knowledge of how it was damaged and how long ago.

description | Repair | You can restore 10 hit points to a damaged object for each hour of work. For any object, you need access to the raw materials required to repair it. For metal objects, you need access to an open flame hot enough to make the metal pliable.
text | Temporarily repair a disabled device｜10
text | Repair an item in half the time｜15
text | Improvise a temporary item using scraps｜20
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Tome of Strahd
contents: text | The Tome of Strahd is an ancient work penned by Strahd, a tragic tale of how he came to his fallen state. The book is bound in a thick leather cover with steel hinges and fastenings. The pages are of parchment and very brittle. Most of the book is written in the curious shorthand that only Strahd employs. Stains and age have made most of the work illegible, but several paragraphs remain intact.

title: Torch
contents: text | A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

title: Torpor
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 4d6 hours. The poisoned creature is incapacitated.

title: Totem
contents: text | A druid can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Trident
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Thrown | Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Trinket
contents: text | When you make your character, you can roll once on the Trinkets table to gain a trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creatures pockets.

title: Truth Serum
contents: text | A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. The poisoned creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a zone of truth spell.

title: Turtle Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 3 mphCarrying Capacity: 30 tons cargoCrew 16, AC 19, HP 300, Damage Threshold 15

text | A turtle ship is encased in a protective metal shell, as befits its name, and bristles with weapons. In addition to its roomy quarters, it can carry a decent- sized payload, making it popular among traders and others who need a lot of cargo space. The ship can land on the ground, and it floats on water. Sliding panels can be closed to make the hull airtight, enabling the ship to travel underwater safely, even to great depths. If the ship takes damage while on or under the water, interior hatches can be sealed to prevent the ship from flooding completely.
text | Standard weaponry on a turtle ship includes three forward-mounted ballistae and a rear-facing mangonel. These weapons can't be used while the ship is underwater.

title: Two-Person Tent
contents: text | A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

title: Tyrant Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 4½ mphCarrying Capacity: 20 tons cargoCrew 10, AC 17, HP 300, Damage Threshold 20

text | Beholders carve tyrant ships out of stone using their disintegration rays and use these ships to wander the Astral Plane, looking for worlds to conquer and rival beholders to destroy. No two tyrant ships look alike, but they all have one or more features reminiscent of their creators, such as a bulbous shape and eyestalks.

text | A spherical chamber on the ship's command deck functions as a spelljamming helm that only beholders can attune to. Any beholder that occupies this chamber can attune to it. Reducing a tyrant ship to 0 hit points not only destroys it but also destroys the ship's spelljamming helm and eyestalk cannons.
text | A tyrant ship can't float on water, but it can safely land on the ground.

title: Vial
contents: text | A vial can hold up to 4 ounces of liquid.

title: Vial of Stardust
contents: text | Any creature that sprinkles the contents of a Vial of Stardust over itself gains the ability to cast the dream spell once as an action (spell save DC 15), requiring no components.

title: Viol
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.
text | Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.
description | History | Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.
description | Performance | Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

description | Compose a Tune | As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

title: Wand
contents: text | A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: War Pick
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon

title: Warhammer
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

title: Warhorse
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 60, Carrying Capacity: 540 lb.

title: Warship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 2½ mphCarrying Capacity: 200 tons cargo, 60 passengersCrew 60, AC 15, HP 500, Damage Threshold 20
description | Crew | A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

text | If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.
description | Passengers | A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
text | Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

description | Damage Threshold | If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.
description | Ship Repair | Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.

title: Wasp Ship
contents: property | Damage | Speed: 5½ mphCarrying Capacity: 10 tons cargoCrew 5, AC 15, HP 250, Damage Threshold 15

text | Wasp ships are lightweight wooden vessels capable of landing safely on the ground, but not on water. They appeal to adventurers because they're affordable and don't require a large crew. Pirates like them because they're swift. Aristocrats are fond of using them as flying yachts because the ship's cargo hold can be easily converted into posh living quarters.
text | The ship's raised back provides high ground for a weapon emplacement, which is typically equipped with a ballista.

title: Waterskin
contents: text | A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

title: Weaver's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.
description | Components | Weaver's tools include thread, needles, and scraps of cloth. You know how to work a loom, but such equipment is too large to transport.
description | Arcana, History | Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining cloth objects, including cloaks and robes.

description | Investigation | Using your knowledge of the process of creating cloth objects, you can spot clues and make deductions that others would overlook when you examine tapestries, upholstery, clothing, and other woven items.
description | Repair | As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged cloth object.
description | Craft Clothing | Assuming you have access to sufficient cloth and thread, you can create an outfit for a creature as part of a long rest.
text | Mend a hole in a piece of cloth｜10
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Wheat
contents: text | Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

title: Whip
contents: property | Type | Martial weapon, melee weapon
description | Finesse | Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.
description | Reach | Adds 5 feet to your reach.

title: White Ghost Orchid Seed
contents: text | More rarely, the orchids produce a smaller pod holding a single white seed. Among its various magical properties, if a white seed is ground and scattered over a dead body, the body is affected by the resurrection spell. A white ghost orchid seed has no effect if consumed.

title: Wildroot
contents: text | Introducing the juice of a wildroot into a poisoned creature's bloodstream (for example, by rubbing it on an open wound) rids the creature of the poisoned condition. Once used in this way, a wildroot loses this property.

title: Woodcarver's Tools
contents: text | Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.
text | Woodcarver's tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.
description | Components | Woodcarver's tools consist of a knife, a gouge, and a small saw.
description | Arcana, History | Your expertise lends you additional insight when you examine wooden objects, such as figurines or arrows.
description | Nature | Your knowledge of wooden objects gives you some added insight when you examine trees.
description | Repair | As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged wooden object.
description | Craft Arrows | As part of a short rest, you can craft up to five arrows. As part of a long rest, you can craft up to twenty. You must have enough wood on hand to produce them.
text | Craft a small wooden figurine｜10
text | Carve an intricate pattern in wood｜15
See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.

title: Wooden Staff
contents: description | Versatile | Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.
text | A druid can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

title: Wukka Nut
contents: text | These fist-sized nuts grow on wukka trees, which are popular haunts for jaculi, su-monsters, and zorbos. A wukka nut rattles when shaken, causing its shell to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This magical light fades after 1 minute, but shaking the nut again causes the light to reappear. If the shell of the nut is cracked open, it loses its magic.

title: Wyvern Poison
contents: text | This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated wyvern. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Yahcha
contents: text | A yahcha (pronounced YAH-chah) is a harmless, meaty beetle about the size of a human hand, which feeds on worms and maggots. It moves slowly (walking speed 10 feet) and is easy to catch. A creature with blue mist fever that eats a raw or cooked yahcha can immediately make a saving throw with advantage against that disease (see "Diseases," page 40),

title: Yew Wand
contents: text | A druid can use this item as a spellcasting focus.
